description: A small, wiry figure with quick hands and a mischievous grin. The Cutpurse Scamp thrives in crowded places, picking pockets and creating distractions. Despite their small stature, they are nimble and resourceful, making them a constant nuisance in urban environments.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.description: The Cutpurse Scamp can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Pickpocket
traits.description: The Cutpurse Scamp has advantage on Sleight of Hand checks to steal items from creatures within 5 feet.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Distract
actions.description: The Cutpurse Scamp can throw a small object or create a noise that distracts a creature within 30 feet, causing it to have disadvantage on its next attack roll.
